overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a methodical approach combining trend analysis and seasonal decomposition to handle limited historical data (4 days). The analyst evaluates multiple methods before selecting a hybrid model that projects a linear trend while incorporating averaged hourly seasonal components. The process shows careful consideration of data limitations and balances simplicity with statistical rigor.
common_data_patterns: Higher evening loads on the last observed day (Monday)
key_insights: Combination of linear trend projection and additive seasonal decomposition for multi-day forecasts
Use of daily mean-adjusted hourly deviations to preserve seasonal patterns
Explicit handling of data scarcity through weighted averaging of available days
Consideration of calendar context (weekday progression) despite limited historical data
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed with multi-step analysis involving time series decomposition, linear regression modeling, and iterative method evaluation. Combines statistical techniques with domain-aware heuristic adjustments.
